channel.title: Cuban Missile Crisis (1962)
channel.description: News about Cuban Missile Crisis (1962). Commentary and archival information about Cuban Missile Crisis (1962) from The New York Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2018 The New York Times Company

item.title: ‘We’ll See,’ Trump Says on North Korea. And Iran. And Nafta. And So On.
item.description: The president’s verbal tic seems to have gone into overdrive, and those who study his speech patterns are starting to wonder: What happens when we finally see what happens?
item.author: By KATIE ROGERS

item.title: Review: In ‘Bobby Kennedy for President,’ a Don Draper of Politics
item.description: A four-part Netflix documentary series recounts a swath of 1960s social and political history, but the man at its center remains elusive.
item.author: By MIKE HALE

item.title: Trump Advisers Urge Tougher Russia Policy After Expulsions
item.description: As diplomats pack their bags, some senior American officials are pressing for a more aggressive approach, but President Trump remains unconvinced.
item.author: By PETER BAKER, ANDREW HIGGINS and STEVEN ERLANGER

item.title: In J.F.K. Files, a Peek Back at an Era of Secrets and Intrigue
item.description: Documents released this week recall the Cold War context against which the assassination of John F. Kennedy generated suspicion that persists to this day.
item.author: By PETER BAKER

item.title: The Madness Behind Trump’s ‘Madman’ Strategy
item.description: It’s tempting to believe the president is just trying to scare Kim Jong-un by acting crazy. If he is, it won’t work.
item.author: By JONATHAN STEVENSON

item.title: Illnesses at U.S. Embassy in Havana Prompt Evacuation of More Diplomats
item.description: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson repeated the American assertion that embassy personnel were deliberately targeted. But he did not blame Cuba.
item.author: By GARDINER HARRIS and ADAM GOLDMAN

item.title: U.S. Seeks U.N. Consent to Interdict North Korean Ships
item.description: The measure would fall short of a full blockade of the kind used in the Cuban missile crisis, but could set the stage for conflicts at sea.
item.author: By DAVID E. SANGER

item.title: Squeezed by an India-China Standoff, Bhutan Holds Its Breath
item.description: There are fears that ambition and nationalism could lead China and India to war again, but now with more firepower at their disposal.
item.author: By STEVEN LEE MYERS

item.title: The Missiles of August
item.description: What J.F.K.’s crisis and Trump’s Korean challenge have in common.
item.author: By ROSS DOUTHAT

item.title: Will the Blowhard Blow Us Up?
item.description: Stumbling toward Armageddon: Can two belligerent leaders living in deranged fantasy worlds tweet and taunt us into a nuclear war?
item.author: By MAUREEN DOWD
